summary: Feature request to add Deno support to the TypeScript SDK. The request would enable developers to write Temporal code using Deno's native Web APIs and run TypeScript without a build step.
userImpact: Developers wanting to use Temporal workflows in Deno environments cannot currently do so, limiting the SDK's compatibility with the Deno runtime.
rootCause: TypeScript SDK relies heavily on Node.js-specific APIs (Worker Threads, VMs, async hooks, native libraries) that are not fully compatible or available in Deno, requiring significant architectural redesign.
proposedFix: Redesign key SDK components and potentially the Core SDK to work as a WASM module instead of NAPI library, with compatibility abstractions for Deno's implementations.
resolutionDetails: Closed as a long-term objective that would require considerable rewriting of multiple components. The project uses a different system to track and prioritize large-scale objectives.
keyQuote: In practice, I expect that we'll probably need to rewrite/redesign several key components of the TypeScript SDK to get it to run reliably and efficiently on Deno.
